Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2010 02:07AM 4Darla wrote: BioAdoptMom3, My ultrasound and the ultrasound guided biopsy were performed by a close coworkers daughter.  She was very somber throughout the procedures.  I was told later that she tries not to show much emotion other than positive support during the procedure because they really don't know much until the biopsy results return.  In my case, the radiologist was having a hard time getting samples of my tumor and gave me the option of returning in six months to see if there was any change.  If he had known it was cancer he would not have suggested to wait months.  I don't believe they can tell much from the mammo and ultrasound other than it's unusual. The feedback you receive on these boards is coming from those who have received positive results.  The 80% who receive B9 results are not usually here but they outnumber us by a large margin.  I hope you are among those 80% and never need to return to this site.  If you have to join this group, know that BC is very treatable and there is a wealth of knowledge here.  Think positive thoughts and don't let the demeanor of medical workers dictate how you feel.  They could be acting somber because of a multitude of personal reasons. Keeping my fingers crossed that all turns out well for you!
Posts.Title: Newbie, worried, comments? BioAdoptMom3 4Darla
